executive_summary: The Frozen Yogurt Stores industry comprises establishments that primarily prepare or serve frozen yogurt and other frozen yogurt-based items, as well as toppings. Over the five years to 2021, the industry has experienced declining revenue due to lower demand for frozen yogurt and the industry's oversaturation. The popularity of frozen yogurt experienced a resurgence that began in 2005 when it was reintroduced by major player Pinkberry. It experienced explosive growth but has since begun to decline during the five-year period as other food fads such as gourmet donuts and freshly pressed juices have begun to take over. Over the five years to 2021, industry revenue is anticipated to decline an annualized 11.5% to $676.6 million. However, industry revenue is estimated to increase 2.3% in 2021 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The Frozen Yogurt Stores industry includes establishments that primarily prepare or serve frozen yogurt and other frozen yogurt-based items, as well as toppings.
After 2005, the industry experienced a proliferation of new frozen yogurt stores that expanded rapidly, driven by explosive demand for frozen yogurt across the country as the trend caught fire.
However, an overly saturated market combined with waning customer demand has driven a decline in revenue over the five years to 2021.
Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, industry operators shifted to operate with takeout and delivery services only, dampening industry revenue.
Over the five years to 2021, industry revenue is estimated to decline an annualized 11.5% to $676.6 million.
Despite the downward trend, revenue in 2021 alone is projected to increase 2.3%.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Over the next five years, the industry revenue is expected to continue on its downward trajectory.
Over the five years to 2026, industry revenue is anticipated to decrease an annualized 4.3% to $542.5 million.
The industry is anticipated to continue its correction, which will include the exit of underperforming stores.
More operators are expected to expand product offerings to include other complementary health foods and trendy desserts.
The number of establishments will decline at an annualized rate of 5.3% to 1,399 stores.
Industry employment is expected to decrease at an annualized rate of 4.4% over the next five years to 12,798 employees in 2026.

industry_definition: This industry includes establishments that primarily prepare or serve frozen yogurt and other frozen yogurt-based items, as well as toppings.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Industry analysis suggests that frozen yogurt consumption is heavily skewed toward women, who account for an estimated 57.0% of industry revenue.
Of the age group segments, consumers who are 18 to 24 make up the largest market segment, accounting for an estimated 32.0% of the industry's total sales.
Consumers under 18 account for 12.4% of industry revenue.
Consumers aged 35 to 49 account for 11.7% of industry revenue.
Consumers aged 65 and over account for 11.5% of industry revenue.

products_and_services.product_description: Full-service frozen yogurt stores account for an estimated 16.7% of industry revenue in 2021. Full-service stores differ from self-serve stores in that frozen yogurt stations and toppings are located behind the counter; a store employee builds an order to a customer's liking and then serves it to the customer.

Unlike full-service stores that require employees to fulfill customers' orders, self-serve stores give customers complete control over the quantity, flavors and toppings. Self-serve stores typically have a row of yogurt stations that are preloaded with different flavors; customers then walk through the line and fill their cups with as many flavors and toppings as they wish. The yogurt is then charged by weight at a price set by individual stores.

Frozen yogurt locations, both full-service and self-service, offer toppings for their yogurt. Self-serve clients can choose from a selection of toppings that they can spoon onto their own yogurt. These toppings add weight to the yogurt and are priced at the same cost as the yogurt itself when weighed at checkout. Full-service yogurt shop employees will often take the order of the toppings of a customer and add a predetermined amount of the topping to a yogurt order and add a fixed price to each order based on the number of toppings chosen. Since frozen yogurt is considered a healthier frozen dessert alternative, candy toppings help consumers satiate a sweet tooth without the feeling of overindulgence and fruit toppings help buyers add more flavor to a healthy treat. Some franchises also sell apparel such as hats and shirts.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Frozen yogurt sales are considered discretionary; therefore, demand is influenced by the level of per capita disposable income and consumer spending. During periods of higher per capita disposable income, consumers are more likely to spend on special snack foods and desserts as they are a highly discretionary spending item.

Demand for frozen yogurt and other trending snack foods is influenced by food fads and trends. Demand for frozen yogurt surged when it regained its popularity and has since declined as the frozen yogurt bubble has deflated.

The level of health consciousness among US consumers also tends to influence demand for this industry's products. In recent years, consumers have become far more health-conscious, in particular about calories and fat content. Rising health concerns have traditionally been the driving force behind frozen yogurt demand, as more consumers chose low-fat and low-sugar frozen yogurt over ice cream to satisfy their sweet tooth.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Frozen yogurt stores do not directly participate in international trade. Rather, yogurt and various toppings are often sourced from a variety of domestic and international locations.

business_locations.location_description: The West region is expected to host the highest number of frozen yogurt establishments, with 28.6% of the industry's total. The region's high concentration can be single-handedly attributed to the state of California, which accounts for 20.4% of total establishments. California is the domestic birthplace of tart frozen yogurt.

regulations_points.regulation_description: There are more than 3,000 state, local and tribal agencies that have responsibility to regulate the retail food and foodservice industries in the United States.
The industry employs a high number of young and low-skilled workers at hourly rates and, therefore, is subject to minimum wage and employee benefits regulations.
A large proportion of industry establishments are operated under franchise agreements. There are both federal and state laws governing franchising, which vary from state to state.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Operators that plan to enter this industry are not particularly constrained by the capital investment required to open a frozen yogurt store.
Entry can also occur through signing a franchise agreement, where costs are relatively less expensive than other food establishments.
While not a formal barrier to entry, high competition may prevent new operators from entering the industry.

basis_points.basis_title: Industry players serve products with little differentiation
basis_points.basis_description: Industry players serve products with little differentiation; therefore, operators also endure considerable price-based competition.
Industry operators also compete on the basis of the store location. Stores that locate near high-traffic locations will generate higher sales through added exposures.
Branding and promotional strategies play an important role in differentiating products or brands from the stifling clutter.

basis_points.basis_title: Yogurtland invests in R&D for innovative flavors
basis_points.basis_description: Yogurtland significantly invests in research and development (R&D) for in-house development of innovative flavors.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Top players account for less than 5% revenue
concentration_points.concentration_description: IBISWorld estimates that in 2021, the combined revenue of the top players accounts for less than 5.0% of total industry revenue.

Compared with other foodservice restaurants, frozen yogurt shops require little kitchen space and less labor. This made it a business model that was easy to franchise and as a result, enabled chain retail establishments to expand rapidly.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Franchise fees are paid out by franchisees to their parent company, which covers the cost of operating under an established brand and earning a profit under the name.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Capital expenditure for this industry comes in the form of fixtures and fittings such as yogurt refrigerators and dispensers, display shelving such as caddies for yogurt toppings, chairs and tables for customer seating and point-of-sale systems such as cash registers and credit card machines.

Large capital outlays are necessary at the outset of the business, as the majority of companies operating in this industry are franchises, and many franchisors will outline the costs associated with setup and supply fixtures and equipment to the franchisee for a fee.
Overall, the Frozen Yogurt Stores industry spends about $0.10 on assets for every dollar spent on wages, indicating a medium level of capital intensity.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Over the past five years, self-serve store formats have become increasingly popular. This trend has popularized frozen yogurt dispensers in many new locations.
Most operators now have point-of-sale systems in stores to speed up service, which helps lead to larger purchases on average and cuts down on labor costs.
The use of the internet has also become more prevalent among industry operators. Companies often provide special offers through online media to generate store traffic and sales.

FAQs.question: Does your company partner with local merchants to market your products and services?
FAQs.answer: Many frozen yogurt stores value tapping into the local communities in which they operate. As a result, some may engage in cooperative marketing with other businesses nearby.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales affected by seasonality?
FAQs.answer: The frozen yogurt industry is highly sensitive to seasonal fluctuations in demand. During colder months, there is markedly less demand for frozen yogurt.

FAQs.question: Is your company located in high-traffic areas to increase visibility?
FAQs.answer: The majority of all frozen yogurt stores succeed by locating themselves in high profit retail destination locations that increase visibility and traffic to stores. As a result, this also tends to increase rent costs.

FAQs.question: Do you offer ancillary products to diversify revenue streams?
FAQs.answer: To insulate themselves from the frozen yogurt fad, many industry operators have begun to offer complementary products such as other health foods or desserts. For example, Red Mango offers smoothies, freshly squeezed juices and acai bowls in addition to frozen yogurt.

FAQs.question: Does your establishment offer complimentary Wi-Fi to customers?
FAQs.answer: As demand for frozen yogurt is lower and competition is high, many operators have attempted to differentiate themselves by adding value through other products and services.

FAQs.question: What point-of-sale systems (i.e. Square) does your company use to reduce labor costs?
FAQs.answer: The majority of frozen yogurt shops use POS systems in order to better organize financial records and monitor inventory. POS systems are ubiquitous.

FAQs.question: What measures does your company take to ensure compliance with food handling and safety laws?
FAQs.answer: The FDA requires that companies advertising certain nutritional claims, such as low-fat, must be able to demonstrate a reasonable basis for the claim. This applies to many frozen yogurt shops since industry operators often claim their dessert to be healthy, all natural, no-sugar-added or low-fat.

FAQs.question: Is your company subject to any franchising laws?
FAQs.answer: The majority of industry establishments are franchise locations. As a result, these shops are governed by both federal and state franchising laws.

FAQs.question: How does your company compensate for the seasonality of cash flow?
FAQs.answer: Demand, is highly seasonal for frozen yogurt, especially in states that experience harsh winters. As a result, industry operators have had to engage several strategies in order to support revenue during winter months, including sales and promotional campaigns or product expansion.

FAQs.question: What ongoing financing challenges does your company face?
FAQs.answer: Many frozen yogurt companies are experiencing declining revenue. Rent costs are high since shops must be located in high traffic areas, which has squeezed profit margins. As a result, many industry operators have closed under performing stores to remain financially viable.

FAQs.question: Is your company a part of a franchise? What has been the most advantageous aspect of this relationship?
FAQs.answer: Being part of a franchise with an established name and system can help operators when entering a competitive sector of the industry, such as frozen yogurt retailing.

FAQs.question: How much of your production is devoted to premium products? Do you spend on marketing to position your products as top-quality?
FAQs.answer: High-quality yogurt can demand a price premium, which reflects well in operators' revenue and profit.

FAQs.question: What measures do you have in place to reduce operational costs? What have you done in the past to reduce costs?
FAQs.answer: Cost controls are important in this relatively low margin industry, particularly related to food inputs.

FAQs.question: What marketing strategies do you employ to encourage purchases from price-conscious consumers? Do you closely track consumer confidence?
FAQs.answer: The Consumer Confidence Index measures buyers' current financial situation and their expectations of future finances.

FAQs.question: Over the past five years, how has the price of milk affected your company's profit? How will an increasing price of milk affect your company?
FAQs.answer: Milk is a key ingredient of many frozen yogurt varieties.

FAQs.question: Do you keep track of per capita sugar and sweetener consumption? How does a decline affect your revenue?
FAQs.answer: Per capita consumption of sugar and other caloric sweeteners has declined slowly over the five years to 2021.
